casebody.data:
CELINA MUTUAL CASUALTY COMPANY, Appellant, v. H. Kenneth CONKLIN, Appellee. No. 11399. United States Court of Appeals Sixth Circuit. Dec. 13, 1951. George R. Smith, Dale R. Booth, Lexington, Ky., for appellant. Stoll, Keenon & Park and Leer Buckley, all of Lexington, Ky., for appellee.

Before SIMONS, MARTIN, and McAL-LISTER, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

The above cause coming on to be heard upon the transcript of record, the briefs of the parties, and the argument of counsel in open court, and the court being duly advised,

Now, therefore, it is hereby ordered, adjudged, and decreed that the judgment of the District Court be and the same is hereby affirmed.
